name: Hake in Neapolitan Sauce with Gluten-Free Pasta
author: Gerhard Visser
summary: Delicious hake chunks in a red wine Neapolitan sauce served on a bed of gluten-free pasta. Garnish with Parmesan cheese and chopped parsley.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon lemon juice, or to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer
Add hake, cover, and steam until easily flaked with a fork, about 25 minutes
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil
Cook pasta in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until tender yet firm to the bite, about 10 minutes
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Add red onion, tomato paste, and garlic; cook and stir until dark and thick, 2 to 3 minutes
Pour in red wine; cook for 1 minute
Stir in canned tomatoes, oregano, basil, and dill weed
Simmer sauce until thickened, about 5 minutes
Cut hake into 1-inch chunks and stir into the sauce
Season sauce with lemon juice, salt, and pepper
